sn48.19:1.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn48.19:2.1: “Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘accomplished regarding the faculties’.
sn48.19:2.2: How is someone accomplished regarding the faculties defined?”
sn48.19:2.3: “Mendicant, it’s when a mendicant develops the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom that lead to peace and awakening.
sn48.19:2.4: This is how someone who is accomplished regarding the faculties is defined.”
